episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the surprising effects of breakdancing on hair loss, unusual laws in North Korea regarding the treatment of images of their leaders, a unique football competition between war and peace studies departments, and the linguistic peculiarities of Spanish in distinguishing between afternoon and evening.

facts.fact: Break dancing can make you go bald.
In North Korea, it's illegal to rest your cup of tea on a newspaper if that newspaper has a picture of Kim Il-sung on it.
In the UK, there is a football competition called the Tolstoy Cup, in which the War Studies Department at King's College London takes on the Peace Studies Department at the University of Bradford.
Spanish people have no way of telling the afternoon from the evening.
